required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: FCR Versus FC Alone in the Treatment of Chronic Lymphocytic Leukemia (CLL) in Relapsed Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Open-label, Multicenter, Randomized, Comparative, Phase III Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of FCR vs. FC Alone in Previously Treated Patients With CD20 Positive B-cell CLL

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to provide treatment for patients who have chronic lymphocytic leukemia (CLL), and to compare the use of rituximab added to fludarabine+cyclophosphamide (FC) with FC alone, to determine if rituximab lengthens the time a patient remains free of leukemia symptoms.

primary_outcome.measure: Progression-free Survival (PFS) as Assessed by the Independent Review Committee (IRC)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Mean observation time at time of analysis was approximately 26 months
primary_outcome.description: Progression-free survival as assessed by the IRC was defined as the time between randomization and the date of first documented disease progression, relapse after response, or death from any cause, whichever came first. Patients without a PFS event were censored at their last tumor assessment date.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Progression-free Survival (PFS) Events Assessed by the Independent Review Committee (IRC)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Mean observation time at time of analysis was approximately 26 months
primary_outcome.description: Progression-free survival as assessed by the IRC was defined as the time between randomization and the date of first documented disease progression, relapse after response, or death from any cause (PFS events), whichever came first. Patients without a PFS event were censored at their last tumor assessment date.

primary_outcome.measure: Final Analysis: Time to Progression-Free Survival Event
primary_outcome.time_frame: Median observation time was approximately 5 years
primary_outcome.description: Time to progression-free survival (PFS) event was defined as the time between randomization and the date of first documented PFS event: disease progression, relapse or death by any cause, whichever came first.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Mean observation time at time of analysis was approximately 26 months
secondary_outcome.description: Overall survival was determined from the date of randomization to the date of death irrespective of cause. Patients who had not died at the time of the final analysis (clinical data cut-off) were censored at the date of the last contact.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Overall Survival (OS) Events
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Mean observation time at time of analysis was approximately 26 months
secondary_outcome.description: Overall survival was determined from the date of randomization to the date of death (OS event) irrespective of cause. Patients who had not died at the time of the final analysis (clinical data cut-off) were censored at the date of the last contact.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Mean observation time at time of analysis was approximately 26 months
secondary_outcome.description: Event free survival was measured from the day of randomization to the date of first documented PD, relapse after response, start of a new treatment or death from any cause. Patients without an EFS event were censored at their last tumor assessment date.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Event-free Survival (EFS) Events
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Mean observation time at time of analysis was approximately 26 months
secondary_outcome.description: Event free survival was measured from the day of randomization to the date of first documented Progressive Disease (PD), relapse after response, start of a new treatment or death from any cause (EFS events). Patients without an EFS event were censored at their last tumor assessment date.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Mean observation time at time of analysis was approximately 26 months
secondary_outcome.description: Disease free survival was defined for all patients with a best overall response (BOR) of Complete Response (CR) and measured the time from first documented CR in a sequence of consecutive CRs until documented disease progression, relapse or death from any cause. Patients without a DFS event at the time of the analysis (clinical data cut-off) were censored at their last tumor assessment date.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Disease-free Survival (DFS) Events
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Mean observation time at time of analysis was approximately 26 months
secondary_outcome.description: Disease free survival was defined for all patients with a best overall response (BOR) of Complete Response (CR) and measured the time from first documented CR in a sequence of consecutive CRs until documented disease progression, relapse or death from any cause (DFS events). Patients without a DFS event at the time of the analysis (clinical data cut-off) were censored at their last tumor assessment date.

secondary_outcome.measure: Final Analysis: Time to Overall Survival Event
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Median observation time was approximately 5 years
secondary_outcome.description: Overall survival (OS) was determined from the date of randomization to the date of death (OS event) irrespective of cause.

secondary_outcome.measure: Final Analysis: Time to Event-Free Survival Event
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Median observation time was approximately 5 years
secondary_outcome.description: Event free survival (EFS) was defined as the time from the day of randomization to the date of first EFS event: documented disease progression, relapse after response, start of a new treatment or death from any cause.

secondary_outcome.measure: Final Analysis: Percentage of Participants With Complete Response
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Median observation time was approximately 5 years
secondary_outcome.description: Complete response was defined as the disappearance of all signs of cancer in response to treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Final Analysis: Time to Disease-Free Survival Event
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Median observation time was approximately 5 years
secondary_outcome.description: Time to disease-free survival (DFS) event was defined as the time from first documented response until the first documented DFS event: disease progression, relapse or death from any cause.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Median observation time was approximately 5 years
secondary_outcome.description: Duration of response was defined as the time between the date of the earliest qualifying response and the date of disease progression or death due to any cause.

secondary_outcome.measure: Final Analysis: Time to New Chronic Lymphocytic Leukemia (CLL) Treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Median observation time was approximately 5 years
secondary_outcome.description: Time to new CCL treatment was defined as the time from randomization to the first day of new treatment for CCL or death.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age ≥18 years
- Established diagnosis of B-cell CLL by NCI Working Group criteria
- ≤1 previous line of chemotherapy
- Expected survival >6 months
- Acceptable hematologic status, liver function, renal function, and pulmonary function
- Negative serum pregnancy test for both pre-menopausal women and for women who are < 2 years after the onset of menopause
- Written informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Prior treatment with interferon, rituximab or other monoclonal antibody
- Prior allogeneic bone marrow transplant (BMT) or autologous BMT or peripheral stem cell transplant (PBSCT) or patients who are considered to be candidates for allogeneic or autologous BMT or PSCT as assessed by their treating physician
- Fertile men or women of childbearing potential not using adequate contraception
- Severe Grade 3 or 4 non-hematological toxicity or prolonged (> 2 weeks) Grade 3 or 4 cytopenia on prior fludarabine or nucleoside analogue regimen
- History of fludarabine-induced or clinically significant autoimmune cytopenia
- History of other malignancies within 2 years prior to study entry, except for adequately treated carcinoma in situ of the cervix; basal or squamous cell skin cancer; low-grade early stage localized prostate cancer treated surgically with curative intent; good prognosis ductal carcinoma in situ (DCIS) of the breast treated with lumpectomy alone with curative intent.
- Medical conditions requiring long term use (> 1 month) of systemic corticosteroids
- Active bacterial, viral, or fungal infection requiring systemic therapy
- Severe cardiac disease
- Seizure disorders requiring anticonvulsant therapy
- Severe chronic obstructive pulmonary disease with hypoxemia
- Uncontrolled diabetes mellitus or hypertension
- Transformation to aggressive B-cell malignancy.
- Known infection with HIV, HCV, or hepatitis B
- Treatment with any other investigational agent, or participation in another clinical trial within 30 days prior to entering this study
- Known hypersensitivity or anaphylactic reactions to murine antibodies or proteins
- Any co-existing medical or psychological condition that would preclude participation in the study or compromise ability to give informed consent

group.title: Fludarabine+Cyclophosphamide (FC)
group.description: Fludarabine+cyclophosphamide (FC) intravenously for a total of 6 treatment cycles at intervals of 28 days. Fludarabine: 25 mg/m² IV on Days 1, 2, 3 for 6 cycles. Cyclophosphamide: 250 mg/m² IV on Days 1, 2, 3 for 6 cycles.

group.title: Fludarabine+Cyclophosphamide+Rituximab (FCR)
group.description: Rituximab and FC intravenously for a total of 6 treatment cycles at intervals of 28 days. Cycle 1: rituximab 375 mg/m² IV on Day 1; fludarabine 25 mg/m² IV on Days 2, 3, 4; cyclophosphamide 250 mg/m² IV on Days 2, 3, 4. Cycles 2-6: rituximab 500 mg/m² IV on Day 1; fludarabine 25 mg/m² IV on Days 1, 2, 3; cyclophosphamide 250 mg/m² IV on Days 1, 2, 3.

group.title: Fludarabine+Cyclophosphamide (FC)
group.description: Fludarabine+cyclophosphamide (FC) intravenously for a total of 6 treatment cycles at intervals of 28 days. Fludarabine: 25 mg/m² IV on Days 1, 2, 3 for 6 cycles. Cyclophosphamide: 250 mg/m² IV on Days 1, 2, 3 for 6 cycles.

group.title: Fludarabine+Cyclophosphamide+Rituximab (FCR)
group.description: Rituximab and FC intravenously for a total of 6 treatment cycles at intervals of 28 days. Cycle 1: rituximab 375 mg/m² IV on Day 1; fludarabine 25 mg/m² IV on Days 2, 3, 4; cyclophosphamide 250 mg/m² IV on Days 2, 3, 4. Cycles 2-6: rituximab 500 mg/m² IV on Day 1; fludarabine 25 mg/m² IV on Days 1, 2, 3; cyclophosphamide 250 mg/m² IV on Days 1, 2, 3.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Progression-free Survival (PFS) as Assessed by the Independent Review Committee (IRC)
outcome.description: Progression-free survival as assessed by the IRC was defined as the time between randomization and the date of first documented disease progression, relapse after response, or death from any cause, whichever came first. Patients without a PFS event were censored at their last tumor assessment date.
outcome.time_frame: Mean observation time at time of analysis was approximately 26 months
outcome.population: Intent-to-treat (ITT) population was comprised of all patients randomized in the study, irrespective of whether they received treatment or not.

group.title: Fludarabine+Cyclophosphamide (FC)
group.description: Fludarabine+cyclophosphamide (FC) intravenously for a total of 6 treatment cycles at intervals of 28 days. Fludarabine: 25 mg/m² IV on Days 1, 2, 3 for 6 cycles. Cyclophosphamide: 250 mg/m² IV on Days 1, 2, 3 for 6 cycles.

group.title: Fludarabine+Cyclophosphamide+Rituximab (FCR)
group.description: Rituximab and FC intravenously for a total of 6 treatment cycles at intervals of 28 days. Cycle 1: rituximab 375 mg/m² IV on Day 1; fludarabine 25 mg/m² IV on Days 2, 3, 4; cyclophosphamide 250 mg/m² IV on Days 2, 3, 4. Cycles 2-6: rituximab 500 mg/m² IV on Day 1; fludarabine 25 mg/m² IV on Days 1, 2, 3; cyclophosphamide 250 mg/m² IV on Days 1, 2, 3.

measure.title: Progression-free Survival (PFS) as Assessed by the Independent Review Committee (IRC)
measure.description: Progression-free survival as assessed by the IRC was defined as the time between randomization and the date of first documented disease progression, relapse after response, or death from any cause, whichever came first. Patients without a PFS event were censored at their last tumor assessment date.
measure.population: Intent-to-treat (ITT) population was comprised of all patients randomized in the study, irrespective of whether they received treatment or not.

analysis.groups_desc: The null hypothesis was that there was no difference between the 2 treatment groups. The alternative hypothesis was that progression-free survival was longer in the fludarabine+cyclophosphamide+rituximab (FCR) group.
analysis.estimate_desc: The hazard ratio was estimated using Cox regression. The hazard ratio is relative to the fludarabine+cyclophosphamide(FC) group.

outcome.title: Overall Survival (OS)
outcome.description: Overall survival was determined from the date of randomization to the date of death irrespective of cause. Patients who had not died at the time of the final analysis (clinical data cut-off) were censored at the date of the last contact.
outcome.time_frame: Mean observation time at time of analysis was approximately 26 months
outcome.population: Intent-to-treat (ITT) population was comprised of all patients randomized in the study, irrespective of whether they received treatment or not.

outcome.description: Disease free survival was defined for all patients with a best overall response (BOR) of Complete Response (CR) and measured the time from first documented CR in a sequence of consecutive CRs until documented disease progression, relapse or death from any cause (DFS events). Patients without a DFS event at the time of the analysis (clinical data cut-off) were censored at their last tumor assessment date.
outcome.time_frame: Mean observation time at time of analysis was approximately 26 months
outcome.population: Intent-to-treat (ITT) population with a Best Overall Response of Complete Response.

group.title: Fludarabine+Cyclophosphamide (FC)
group.description: Fludarabine+cyclophosphamide (FC) intravenously for a total of 6 treatment cycles at intervals of 28 days. Fludarabine: 25 mg/m² IV on Days 1, 2, 3 for 6 cycles. Cyclophosphamide: 250 mg/m² IV on Days 1, 2, 3 for 6 cycles.

group.title: Fludarabine+Cyclophosphamide+Rituximab (FCR)
group.description: Rituximab and FC intravenously for a total of 6 treatment cycles at intervals of 28 days. Cycle 1: rituximab 375 mg/m² IV on Day 1; fludarabine 25 mg/m² IV on Days 2, 3, 4; cyclophosphamide 250 mg/m² IV on Days 2, 3, 4. Cycles 2-6: rituximab 500 mg/m² IV on Day 1; fludarabine 25 mg/m² IV on Days 1, 2, 3; cyclophosphamide 250 mg/m² IV on Days 1, 2, 3.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Disease-free Survival (DFS) Events
measure.description: Disease free survival was defined for all patients with a best overall response (BOR) of Complete Response (CR) and measured the time from first documented CR in a sequence of consecutive CRs until documented disease progression, relapse or death from any cause (DFS events). Patients without a DFS event at the time of the analysis (clinical data cut-off) were censored at their last tumor assessment date.
measure.population: Intent-to-treat (ITT) population with a Best Overall Response of Complete Response.

outcome.title: Final Analysis: Time to Progression-Free Survival Event
outcome.description: Time to progression-free survival (PFS) event was defined as the time between randomization and the date of first documented PFS event: disease progression, relapse or death by any cause, whichever came first.
outcome.time_frame: Median observation time was approximately 5 years
outcome.population: Participants from the Intent-to-treat population, all randomized participants, who experienced a PFS event. Participants who did not have a PFS event at the time of the final analysis were censored at the date of the last contact.

group.title: Fludarabine+Cyclophosphamide (FC)
group.description: Fludarabine+cyclophosphamide (FC) intravenously for a total of 6 treatment cycles at intervals of 28 days. Fludarabine: 25 mg/m² IV on Days 1, 2, 3 for 6 cycles. Cyclophosphamide: 250 mg/m² IV on Days 1, 2, 3 for 6 cycles.

group.title: Fludarabine+Cyclophosphamide+Rituximab (FCR)
group.description: Rituximab and FC intravenously for a total of 6 treatment cycles at intervals of 28 days. Cycle 1: rituximab 375 mg/m² IV on Day 1; fludarabine 25 mg/m² IV on Days 2, 3, 4; cyclophosphamide 250 mg/m² IV on Days 2, 3, 4. Cycles 2-6: rituximab 500 mg/m² IV on Day 1; fludarabine 25 mg/m² IV on Days 1, 2, 3; cyclophosphamide 250 mg/m² IV on Days 1, 2, 3.

measure.title: Final Analysis: Time to Progression-Free Survival Event
measure.description: Time to progression-free survival (PFS) event was defined as the time between randomization and the date of first documented PFS event: disease progression, relapse or death by any cause, whichever came first.
measure.population: Participants from the Intent-to-treat population, all randomized participants, who experienced a PFS event. Participants who did not have a PFS event at the time of the final analysis were censored at the date of the last contact.

outcome.title: Final Analysis: Time to Overall Survival Event
outcome.description: Overall survival (OS) was determined from the date of randomization to the date of death (OS event) irrespective of cause.
outcome.time_frame: Median observation time was approximately 5 years
outcome.population: The analysis included only those participants from the Intent-to-treat population,all randomized participants, who died. Participants who had not died at the time of the final analysis were censored at the date of the last contact.

group.title: Fludarabine+Cyclophosphamide (FC)
group.description: Fludarabine+cyclophosphamide (FC) intravenously for a total of 6 treatment cycles at intervals of 28 days. Fludarabine: 25 mg/m² IV on Days 1, 2, 3 for 6 cycles. Cyclophosphamide: 250 mg/m² IV on Days 1, 2, 3 for 6 cycles.

group.title: Fludarabine+Cyclophosphamide+Rituximab (FCR)
group.description: Rituximab and FC intravenously for a total of 6 treatment cycles at intervals of 28 days. Cycle 1: rituximab 375 mg/m² IV on Day 1; fludarabine 25 mg/m² IV on Days 2, 3, 4; cyclophosphamide 250 mg/m² IV on Days 2, 3, 4. Cycles 2-6: rituximab 500 mg/m² IV on Day 1; fludarabine 25 mg/m² IV on Days 1, 2, 3; cyclophosphamide 250 mg/m² IV on Days 1, 2, 3.

measure.title: Final Analysis: Time to Overall Survival Event
measure.description: Overall survival (OS) was determined from the date of randomization to the date of death (OS event) irrespective of cause.
measure.population: The analysis included only those participants from the Intent-to-treat population,all randomized participants, who died. Participants who had not died at the time of the final analysis were censored at the date of the last contact.

outcome.title: Final Analysis: Time to Event-Free Survival Event
outcome.description: Event free survival (EFS) was defined as the time from the day of randomization to the date of first EFS event: documented disease progression, relapse after response, start of a new treatment or death from any cause.
outcome.time_frame: Median observation time was approximately 5 years
outcome.population: Participants from the Intent-to-treat population, all randomized participants, who had an EFS event. Participants who did not have an ESF event at the time of the final analysis were censored at the date of the last contact.

group.title: Fludarabine+Cyclophosphamide (FC)
group.description: Fludarabine+cyclophosphamide (FC) intravenously for a total of 6 treatment cycles at intervals of 28 days. Fludarabine: 25 mg/m² IV on Days 1, 2, 3 for 6 cycles. Cyclophosphamide: 250 mg/m² IV on Days 1, 2, 3 for 6 cycles.

group.title: Fludarabine+Cyclophosphamide+Rituximab (FCR)
group.description: Rituximab and FC intravenously for a total of 6 treatment cycles at intervals of 28 days. Cycle 1: rituximab 375 mg/m² IV on Day 1; fludarabine 25 mg/m² IV on Days 2, 3, 4; cyclophosphamide 250 mg/m² IV on Days 2, 3, 4. Cycles 2-6: rituximab 500 mg/m² IV on Day 1; fludarabine 25 mg/m² IV on Days 1, 2, 3; cyclophosphamide 250 mg/m² IV on Days 1, 2, 3.

measure.title: Final Analysis: Time to Event-Free Survival Event
measure.description: Event free survival (EFS) was defined as the time from the day of randomization to the date of first EFS event: documented disease progression, relapse after response, start of a new treatment or death from any cause.
measure.population: Participants from the Intent-to-treat population, all randomized participants, who had an EFS event. Participants who did not have an ESF event at the time of the final analysis were censored at the date of the last contact.

outcome.title: Final Analysis: Percentage of Participants With Complete Response
outcome.description: Complete response was defined as the disappearance of all signs of cancer in response to treatment.
outcome.time_frame: Median observation time was approximately 5 years
outcome.population: Intent-to-treat population included all randomized participants.

group.title: Fludarabine+Cyclophosphamide (FC)
group.description: Fludarabine+cyclophosphamide (FC) intravenously for a total of 6 treatment cycles at intervals of 28 days. Fludarabine: 25 mg/m² IV on Days 1, 2, 3 for 6 cycles. Cyclophosphamide: 250 mg/m² IV on Days 1, 2, 3 for 6 cycles.

group.description: Rituximab and FC intravenously for a total of 6 treatment cycles at intervals of 28 days. Cycle 1: rituximab 375 mg/m² IV on Day 1; fludarabine 25 mg/m² IV on Days 2, 3, 4; cyclophosphamide 250 mg/m² IV on Days 2, 3, 4. measure.title: Final Analysis: Percentage of Participants With Complete Response
measure.description: Complete response was defined as the disappearance of all signs of cancer in response to treatment.
measure.population: Intent-to-treat population included all randomized participants.

outcome.title: Final Analysis: Time to Disease-Free Survival Event
outcome.description: Time to disease-free survival (DFS) event was defined as the time from first documented response until the first documented DFS event: disease progression, relapse or death from any cause.
outcome.time_frame: Median observation time was approximately 5 years
outcome.population: Participants from the Intent-to-treat population, all randomized participants, with complete response. .

group.title: Fludarabine+Cyclophosphamide (FC)
group.description: Fludarabine+cyclophosphamide (FC) intravenously for a total of 6 treatment cycles at intervals of 28 days. Fludarabine: 25 mg/m² IV on Days 1, 2, 3 for 6 cycles. Cyclophosphamide: 250 mg/m² IV on Days 1, 2, 3 for 6 cycles.

group.description: Rituximab and FC intravenously for a total of 6 treatment cycles at intervals of 28 days. measure.population: Participants from the Intent-to-treat population, all randomized participants, with complete response. .

outcome.title: Final Analysis: Duration of Response
outcome.description: Duration of response was defined as the time between the date of the earliest qualifying response and the date of disease progression or death due to any cause.
outcome.time_frame: Median observation time was approximately 5 years
outcome.population: Participants from the Intent-to-treat population, all randomized participants, with complete or partial response.

group.title: Fludarabine+Cyclophosphamide (FC)
group.description: Fludarabine+cyclophosphamide (FC) intravenously for a total of 6 treatment cycles at intervals of 28 days. Fludarabine: 25 mg/m² IV on Days 1, 2, 3 for 6 cycles. Cyclophosphamide: 250 mg/m² IV on Days 1, 2, 3 for 6 cycles.

group.title: Fludarabine+Cyclophosphamide+Rituximab (FCR)
group.description: Rituximab and FC intravenously for a total of 6 treatment cycles at intervals of 28 days. Cycle 1: rituximab 375 mg/m² IV on Day 1; fludarabine 25 mg/m² IV on Days 2, 3, 4; cyclophosphamide 250 mg/m² IV on Days 2, 3, 4. Cycles 2-6: rituximab 500 mg/m² IV on Day 1; fludarabine 25 mg/m² IV on Days 1, 2, 3; cyclophosphamide 250 mg/m² IV on Days 1, 2, 3.

measure.title: Final Analysis: Duration of Response
measure.description: Duration of response was defined as the time between the date of the earliest qualifying response and the date of disease progression or death due to any cause.
measure.population: Participants from the Intent-to-treat population, all randomized participants, with complete or partial response.

outcome.title: Final Analysis: Time to New Chronic Lymphocytic Leukemia (CLL) Treatment
outcome.description: Time to new CCL treatment was defined as the time from randomization to the first day of new treatment for CCL or death.
outcome.time_frame: Median observation time was approximately 5 years
outcome.population: Participants from the Intent-to-treat population,all randomized participants, who started a new treatment for CLL or died.

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse Events were collected from study start to 28 days after treatment completion (Median observation time= 26 months). Serious Adverse Events were collected 1 year after treatment completion (Median observation time= 37 months).
reported_events.desc: The safety analysis population included all patients who received at least one dose of trial treatment and had at least one safety follow-up, whether withdrawn prematurely or not. 272 patients received FC only and 274 patients received FCR.

group.title: Fludarabine+Cyclophosphamide (FC)
group.description: Fludarabine+cyclophosphamide (FC) intravenously for a total of 6 treatment cycles at intervals of 28 days. Fludarabine: 25 mg/m² IV on Days 1, 2, 3 for 6 cycles. Cyclophosphamide: 250 mg/m² IV on Days 1, 2, 3 for 6 cycles.

group.title: Fludarabine+Cyclophosphamide+Rituximab (FCR)
group.description: Rituximab and FC intravenously for a total of 6 treatment cycles at intervals of 28 days. Cycle 1: rituximab 375 mg/m² IV on Day 1; fludarabine 25 mg/m² IV on Days 2, 3, 4; cyclophosphamide 250 mg/m² IV on Days 2, 3, 4. Cycles 2-6: rituximab 500 mg/m² IV on Day 1; fludarabine 25 mg/m² IV on Days 1, 2, 3; cyclophosphamide 250 mg/m² IV on Days 1, 2, 3.

event.sub_title: Infective Exacerbation of Chronic Obstructive Airways Disease

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The Study being conducted under this Agreement is part of the Overall Study. Investigator is free to publish in reputable journals or to present at professional conferences the results of the Study, but only after the first publication or presentation that involves the Overall Study. The Sponsor may request that Confidential Information be deleted and/or the publication be postponed in order to protect the Sponsor's intellectual property rights.
